Eric Schmidt 's departure had been a long time coming, says Charles Arthur in The Guardian: After slipups with search, Street View and Android, it's clear that Google needs tighter control at the top- and Eric Schmidt is not the man for the job. ''As it has grown into the dominant company in Silicon Valley, Google has lost some of its entrepreneurial culture and become a slower-moving bureaucracy, analysts and insiders say,'' Miller and Helft report. To counter this, the company announced that Larry Page, its 38-year-old co-founder, would take over as chief executive from Eric Schmidt , a technology industry veteran who was brought in a decade ago to provide adult supervision, as Silicon Valley calls it. Close Colin Powell said on Sunday that he was not committed to supporting Barack Obama or any other candidate in 2012 I'm not committed to Barack Obama . I'm not committed to a Republican candidate, Colin Powell said on CNN's ''State of the Union ''I am not committed to any candidate until I see all the candidates and finally see who the two candidates are who are going for this position.''
